article:
A 'biogas upgrader' is a facility that is used to concentrate the methane in
biogas to natural gas standards. The system removes carbon dioxide, hydrogen
sulphide, [http://www.sgc.se/dokument/Evaluation.pdf EVALUATION OF UPGRADING
TECHNIQUES FOR BIOGAS, Margareta Persson, October 2003, School of Environmental
Engineering, Lund University] water and contaminants from the biogas. One
technique for doing this uses amine gas treating. This purified biogas is also
called biomethane. It can be used interchangeably with natural gas.
